messages.title: HS2 referendum: 90% say NO!
messages.content: A huge thank you to all those who took part in our constituency-wide HS2 referendum. 90% will join me in saying NO to HS2 to protect Hampstead and Kilburn's homes and environment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Unemployment has halved across the country, 20,000 start-ups in our area since 2010 and over 1,000 fewer people are out of work. Income inequality is at its lowest since the 1980s.
Five new state schools have opened and our local schools are now rated up to 92% 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.

Increased NHS funding every year. There are now 9,500 more doctors and 7,000 more nurses, and an extra £106 million a year is being put into over 600 new health projects. We'll also increase the Royal Free's A&E capacity.

issues.education: Five new local schools and our local schools are now rated up to 92% 'Good' or 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.
issues.health: Increased NHS funding every year. There are now 9,500 more doctors and 7,000 more nurses, and an extra £106 million a year is being put into over 600 new health projects.

housing.content: 90% say NO to HS2 to protect Hampstead and Kilburn's homes and environment.

politicalExperience.role: Founder of a charity, small businesses, and businesess association
politicalExperience.achievements: Delivered 75,000 children's books across Camden, raised over £500,000 for local business growth.

images.caption: Simon Marcus with supporters and local residents in various campaign activities.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Campaign focused on local employment, education, health and opposition to HS2 project.
